meanings.definition: A type of larval stage of a fly or other insect.
meanings.sent1: The garden was infested with magots, crawling around the decaying fruit.
meanings.sent2: The farmer used pesticides to get rid of the magots infesting the crops.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally left the fruit out too long, attracting magots to the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The garbage bin was a breeding ground for magots, thriving in the warm environment.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the squirming magots made my stomach turn.

meanings.definition: A term of contempt for a person.
meanings.sent1: He called his rival a magots, showing his disdain for him.
meanings.sent2: The bully used the term magots to insult his classmates.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully teased each other, calling names like magots.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the villain was portrayed as a magots, disliked by all.
meanings.sent5: She felt hurt when her friend referred to her as a magots.
